@graph.title: Graphs and Combinatorics : Proceedings of the Capital Conference on Graph Theory and Combinatorics at the George Washington University June 18–22, 1973
@graph.abstract: Recent results on trees -- A survey of generalized ramsey theory -- A survey of the reconstruction conjecture -- Recent results on graphical enumeration -- Is the null-graph a pointless concept? -- Which graphs have integral spectra? -- Generalized ramsey theory for graphs - a survey -- Some recent results in topological graph theory -- A survey of finite embedding theorems for partial latin squares and quasigroups -- Computing the Characteristic polynomial of a graph -- Finding an independent set in a planar graph -- A class of starter induced 1-factorizations -- Chromatically equivalent graphs -- On covering the points of a graph with point disjoint paths -- A useful family of bicubic graphs -- Reconstructing combinatorial geometries -- On triangular and cyclic ramsey numbers with k colors -- The minimality of the mycielski graph -- On the ramsey number of the five-spoked wheel -- On the hamiltonian completion problem -- Coloring seven-circuits -- Absolute retracts in graphs -- Cancelling eulerian graphs -- A graphical realization problem -- The existence of small tactical configurations -- Tactical configurations: An introduction -- Structural characterizations of stability of signed digraphs under pulse processes -- The charm bracelet problem and its applications -- On Tutte's factorization theorem.
